REGULATION OF THE MINISTER OF MARITIME ECONOMY AND INLAND NAVIGATION of 23 March 2020 on the temporary limitation of the functioning of maritime universities in the territory of the Republic of Poland due to the prevention of SARS-CoV-2 virus infection

§1.1. In the period from March 26, 2020. until April 10, 2020 in the territory of the country, the functioning of universities supervised by the minister responsible for maritime economy is limited by: 1) suspension of lectures and other didactic classes organized by the Maritime University in Szczecin and Gdynia Maritime University in the territory of the Republic of Poland; in their area, except in cases where it is necessary to ensure the continuity of the functioning of these universities.

2) limitation of the obligation to perform work by employees of universities listed in paragraph 1 in their area, except in cases where it is necessary to ensure the continuity of the operation of these universities.

Period from March 26, 2020. until April 10, 2020 the university referred to in section 1, which has the infrastructure and software to conduct classes with the use of distance learning methods and techniques, conducts classes using these methods and techniques, regardless of whether it has been provided for in the curriculum of a given education.

§3 The university, referred to in section 1, which during the suspension of lectures and other classes conducted classes using distance learning methods and techniques, may continue to conduct classes using these methods and techniques after the end of the suspension period of lectures and other classes, no longer however, than until September 30, 2020.

Article 25b. In the event of a declaration of an epidemic threat, state of an epidemic or the risk of spreading an infection or an infectious disease that may pose a threat to public health, in particular the occurrence of a particularly dangerous or highly infectious disease, the director of the Institute may postpone the date of the inspection referred to in Art. 25a section 1, once, not longer than for a period of 6 months from the date of lapse of 2 years from the date of the last inspection.
6a. In the event of announcing an epidemic threat or state of an epidemic, the minister competent for health may change the dates referred to in paragraph 6.
In the event of announcing an epidemic threat or state of an epidemic, the minister competent for health may change the dates referred to in paragraph 2.

If the circumstances causing the change of dates persist, the minister responsible for health shall change these dates again, however, the total period of postponing a given date may not exceed 5 months.
The information about the change of these terms is announced by the minister competent for health on his website.

In cases justified by extraordinary circumstances, in particular threatening the life or health of persons qualified to commence specialization training, the minister competent for health may extend the time for commencement of specialization training for a period not longer than 6 months.
In the event of announcing an epidemic threat or an epidemic, the minister competent for health may change the dates referred to in section 4.

In cases justified by extraordinary circumstances, in particular threats to the life or health of people participating in the PESDL, the minister competent for health may revoke all or part of the PESDL in a given field.

By canceling PESDL, the minister responsible for health extends the duration of the examination session in which the canceled examination was to take place, once for a period not longer than 6 months.

The minister competent for health may, by means of a regulation, impose on manufacturers, authorized representatives, distributors and importers of medical devices, producers and importers of foodstuffs for particular nutritional uses or entities responsible for biocidal products, holders of a parallel trade permit or permit and manufacturers of biocidal products

1. The regulation specifies: 1) infectious diseases causing the obligation to isolate or isolate in domestic conditions

REGULATION OF THE MINISTER OF INTERNAL AFFAIRS AND ADMINISTRATION of April 10, 2020 on the temporary limitation of the operation of state services universities

§1.1 In the period from April 11, 2020 until April 26, 2020 the functioning of higher education institutions of state services supervised by the minister responsible for internal affairs is limited by the suspension of education: 1) during studies; 2) at postgraduate studies; 3) in other forms.

2. During the period of suspension of education, classes may be carried out with the use of distance learning methods and techniques, regardless of whether it was provided for in the curriculum of this education.

3. In the case of conducting classes in the manner specified in section 2, the verification of the achieved learning outcomes specified in the curriculum of a given education may take place outside the seat of the university, with the use of IT technologies ensuring control of the verification of the achieved learning outcomes and its registration.
2. During the period of suspension of education, activities related to the awarding of scientific degrees and titles may be suspended, if it is not possible to pass resolutions by secret ballot.

a) in sec. 1, the first sentence is replaced by the following: `In the case of apprenticeships for students of technical secondary schools and post-secondary schools, planned to be carried out in the period in which the functioning of the education system units has been temporarily limited, these apprenticeships are carried out until the end of the 2019/2020 school year or in higher curricular classes (semesters).`

2) in §11b, the current content is marked as para. 1 and paragraph is added. 2-9 in the wording: `2.The recruitment procedure for the school year 2020/2021 to grades I of public secondary schools and entrance classes, referred to in Art. 25 sec. 3 of the Act of December 14, 2016. - Educational law, with the exception of public post-secondary schools, public sectoral secondary schools and public schools for adults, is carried out on new dates specified by the minister responsible for education. The new deadlines for the recruitment procedure as well as the deadlines for submitting documents are made public on the website of the office supporting the minister responsible for education.
